In psychology, 'rigidity' refers to an obstinate inability to yield. A refusal
to appreciate another person's viewpoint or emotions, characterized by a lack of
empathy. A specific example is functional fixedness, which is a difficulty
conceiving new uses for familiar objects. {{cite book
  | last = Davis first = Stephen F. authorlink = coauthors = Palladino, Joseph
  | J. title = Psychology publisher = Pearson Prentice Hall date = 2007 location
